reviews.text: Station looks modern purpose built and seems apt for the location. Work still in progress around the station. Poor signage to the station entrance. Car park ticket machines not in place yet, which is not ideal. Staff can only do so much. Ticket refunds not dealt with here, one will have to go to the main Cambridge station office for that. With a bit of will and luck, things can be a lot better.

Male barrier attentant this morning big chap, red hair, extremely rude to our 16 daughter very intimating as she had pressed off peak instead of peak only a pound difference in ticket prices but followed her to ticket machine made her purchase another ticket to get through the barriers, she felt panicked & aniexty, left crying walking to college by the way he dealt with situation & made her feel... Totalling unnecessary, good job I was at work 😠😠😠😠 genuine mistake.....NOT happy....

Staff are always helpful and friendly here, but every time I've travelled from here it feels like a lonely, deserted place. I don't know that many people use the station, but perhaps that will increase over time. The cafe always seems to be shut, not that I would use it anyway, but be aware it's not open outside of very peak hours. At weekends, definitey a dead place.

In these few years since the station has been opened I must have tried to take a train five or six times. The lift was out of action three times, so I had to look for a different transport. Today, the ticket machine was not accepting cards.

If you want to have a weekend away, you can't pay for a weekend ticket at the ticket machine at the station. You can only pay for 1 day on the day you park. It's not that customers don't want to pay, the company are just making it really ****ing painful.
